questions.question: Which of the following is NOT available in the file manager?
questions.answer: HTML image snippets

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an important reason to familiarize yourself with available settings?
questions.answer: Some templates are coded exclusively in settings.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about menus in HubSpot is FALSE?
questions.answer: The only way to build a menu is with the menu tool.

questions.question: Which of the following CMS tools is used in CAN-SPAM compliance?
questions.answer: Email settings

questions.question: Which CMS tool would you use to find the file size of a PNG?
questions.answer: File manager

questions.question: Which of the following statements about navigation items is FALSE?
questions.answer: Navigation items are automatically created when editors create a new page and cannot be created elsewhere.

questions.question: Which statement about CSS in modules is TRUE?
questions.answer: CSS added to the HTML+ HubL section of the module editor will be repeated on the page in every instance of a module.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about HubL in modules is TRUE?
questions.answer: Module fields are added to module markup with HubL.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about HubL and JavaScript is TRUE?
questions.answer: JS written in the HTML + HubL section of the module editor will be repeated on a page for every instance of a module unless it is wrapped in a require_js statement.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about module fields is TRUE?
questions.answer: Modules can contain logic fields.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about modules is FALSE?
questions.answer: None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following statements does NOT accurately describe HubL?
questions.answer: HubL provides state management for single page apps.

questions.question: Which of the following is not included in HubL?
questions.answer: Classes

questions.question: Which of the following statements about HubL module syntax is NOT TRUE?
questions.answer: HubL modules use three curly braces to open and close tags.

questions.question: Which of the following characters are used to open a HubL statement?
Which of the following is NOT possible with HubL?
questions.answer: Passing data from client side code to HubL

questions.question: Which of the following statements about HubL filters is TRUE?
questions.answer: HubL filters are used for a wide variety of tasks.

questions.question: Which data structure does HubL use for storing data in key and value pairs?
questions.answer: Dictionaries

questions.question: Which of the following HubL and HubDB behaviors should be avoided if possible?
questions.answer: Use multiple requests to the same table to build complex templates.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an aspect of dynamic pages?
questions.answer: Dynamic pages require multiple templates.

questions.question: Which of the following is possible with the command line tools?
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements about templates is NOT TRUE?
questions.answer: Templates can only be used to create one live page in the HubSpot CMS.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about templates is TRUE?
questions.answer: Templates use HubL to create editable areas of pages.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about drag and drop areas is TRUE?
questions.answer: The dnd_area tag is all that is needed for basic drag and drop functionality in the page editor.

questions.question: True or False? People hate dragging and dropping things so the HubSpot CMS does not contain this capability
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Which of the following statements about a healthy codebase is TRUE?
questions.answer: Reducing instances of repeated code helps to keep your codebase tidy and bug free.

questions.question: Which statement about repeating module fields is FALSE?
questions.answer: Repeating fields and flexible columns are the same thing.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about HubSpot CMS themes is TRUE?
questions.answer: Themes are a package of assets that help keep a website consistent.

questions.question: Which file in a theme controls the global fields that content editors can edit?
questions.answer: fields.json

questions.question: Choose all that apply. Which of the following options is configured in the theme.json file?
answer: Link to a preview image for the theme

questions.question: Which of the following statements about global partials is NOT TRUE?
questions.answer: Global partials can only be used on one template in a theme.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about theme modules is TRUE?
questions.answer: Theme modules are a great way to keep sites stylistically consistent.

questions.question: If you wanted to create an unordered list from each value in a dictionary, which aspect of HubL would be most essential?
questions.answer: A Loop

questions.question: How many different email templates should be created?
questions.answer: It depends on the organization and should be discussed with the broader team to align with marketing goals.

questions.question: True or false? The best way to style emails is through an external CSS stylesheet.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or false? You can add modules to your blog listing page in the page editor even if your blog listing template does not contain a drag-and-drop area.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Fill in the blank: You should omit the ______ from the simple listing page using the {% if not_simple_list_page %} statement.
questions.answer: featured image

questions.question: Select all that apply. Which of the following is something that can NOT be added to a dnd_section tag inside a section template.
answer: A link to a style sheet

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about section templates?
questions.answer: Section templates have CSS and JavaScript attached to them, just like modules.

questions.question: In the body of a section template, which tag needs to be the parent tag?
questions.answer: dnd_section

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of the HubSpot CMS of special interest to web developers?
questions.answer: The ability to add PHP anywhere in a template

questions.question: What does the hubspot.config.yml file do?
questions.answer: Configures the relationship between local files and HubSpot CMS accounts including authentication

questions.question: True or false? System templates can only be built using the Design Manager.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What pages are you required to set up when creating membership pages?
questions.answer: registration page, login page, password reset request page, password reset page

questions.question: In the blog listing template, which variable provides access to blog post data?
questions.answer: contents

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an additional page view generated by the blog listing template?
questions.answer: Category page

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If you wanted to copy the HubL markup of a section in the page editor, you would need to _____.
questions.answer: Place the the query string ?developerMode=true at the end of the url to enter developer mode.

questions.question: Select all that apply. In order to create a section template, you need which of the following in the file?
answer: A template annotation with the “templateType” set to the value of “section”.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an important aspect of using HubL?
questions.answer: Memorizing all tags and parameters

questions.question: Choose all that apply. Which of the following are always good strategies for building templates?
answer: Keeping content editors front of mind at all times and optimizing their editing experience.
Building in appropriate guardrails to help content editors quickly build pages and reduce the likelihood of errors and bugs.
Looking for ways to keep your codebase DRY and avoid repeated code that is prone to bugs.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about theme fields is NOT TRUE?
questions.answer: Developers don’t need to worry about how theme fields might be used by editors because theme fields can’t be used to make a website inconsistent or difficult to navigate.
